name: Beef and Vegetable Stir-Fry
description: A quick and healthy stir-fry with beef and a mix of colorful vegetables.
steps: 1. Thinly slice the beef into strips and marinate with a little salt for 10 minutes.
2. Peel and julienne the carrot and sweet potato. Dice the tomato and potato.
3. Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and add a little oil.
4. Add the marinated beef to the pan and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until browned.
5. Add the carrots, sweet potato, and potatoes to the pan and stir-fry for another 5 minutes.
6. Once vegetables are slightly tender, add the tomato and stir in.
7. In a separate bowl, beat the egg and scramble it in the pan until just set.
8. Combine all ingredients, stir well, and serve warm.

name: Tuna Pasta Salad
description: A fresh and light pasta salad with tuna and vegetables.
steps: 1. Cook the pasta in salted boiling water according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
2. While pasta is cooking, drain the tuna and set aside.
3. Dice the tomato and finely grate the carrot.
4. In a large mixing bowl, combine cooked pasta, tuna, diced tomato, grated carrot, and chunks of pineapple.
5. Toss everything together and drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice (if desired).
6. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Egg and Potato Frittata
description: A delicious and filling frittata made with eggs, potatoes, and vegetables.
steps: 1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. Peel the potato and cut it into small cubes. Boil the cubes for about 10 minutes until tender, then drain.
3. In a mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs and season with salt and pepper.
4. In an oven-proof skillet, sauté the chopped carrot until it softens slightly.
5. Add boiled potatoes and diced tomato to the skillet, mixing to combine.
6. Pour the egg mixture over the sautéed vegetables in the skillet.
7. Cook on the stovetop for about 5 minutes until the edges start to set.
8. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes until the center is set.
9. Allow to cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

name: Baked Fish with Sweet Potato
description: A healthy baked dish with fish and sweet potatoes, flavored with herbs or lemon.
steps: 1. Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
2. Peel and cut the sweet potato into wedges. Boil for 10 minutes then drain.
3. Place the fish on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
4. Season the fish with salt, pepper, and lemon juice.
5. Arrange the sweet potato wedges around the fish on the tray.
6. Slice the tomato and place on top of the fish and sweet potatoes.
7. Bake in the oven for 20-25 minutes or until the fish is cooked through and flaky.
8. Serve warm with a wedge of lemon on the side.

name: Fruit Smoothie
description: A refreshing smoothie with a mix of fruits.
steps: 1. Peel the banana and slice it into pieces.
2. Core and chop the apple into chunks.
3. In a blender, add the banana, apple, pineapple, and sugar.
4. Blend on high until smooth and creamy, adding water or ice for desired consistency.
5. Pour into a glass and serve immediately.

name: Mixed Vegetable Soup
description: A warm and hearty vegetable soup made with seasonal veggies.
steps: 1. Peel and chop the carrot, potato, and sweet potato into small pieces.
2. Dice the tomatoes.
3. In a large pot, add 4 cups of water and bring to a boil.
4. Add the chopped vegetables to the pot and season with salt and pepper.
5. Reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes until vegetables are tender.
6. Blend the soup if you prefer a smooth texture, or leave it chunky.
7. Serve hot, garnished with fresh herbs if available.
